comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Mistyped initial? Homer Alvan Rodeheaver was an "American evangelist, music director, music publisher, composer of gospel songs, and pioneer in the recording of sacred music." Looks like him too.

comment.author: 16489083@N05
comment._content: I agree with trialsanderrors... Rodeheaver be­gan his ca­reer tour­ing with the Billy Sun­day evan­gel­ism cam­paign in the ear­ly 20th Cen­tu­ry. Billy Sunday is the famous baseball player turned evangelist who was influenced by the Dwight L. Moody evangelism camp meetings in the early part of his life. .. See: www.hymntime.com/tch/bio/r/o/d/rodeheaver_ha.htm and www.gracyk.com/rodeheaver.shtml .
comment.authorname: maorlando God kept us 2012 leaning on Him 2013

comment.author: 33593953@N02
comment._content: trials and errors: Thanks for identifying Rodeheaver. It does appear that the first initial was incorrect on the original negative. I found other portraits of Homer Rodeheaver in our Biographical File of pictures in the reading room (some with his trademark trombone). And here's another image from the Bain Collection showing him training chorus girls(!): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ggbain.23309 . We'll adjust the description when we next update.
